verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Send thou men, that they may search the land of Canaan, which I give unto the children of Israel: of every tribe of their fathers shall ye send a man, every one a ruler among them.
verses.web: “Send men, that they may spy out the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel. Of every tribe of their fathers, you shall send a man, every one a prince among them.”
verses.ct: "Send men to explore the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the people of Israel. Choose one leader from each ancestral tribe."

verses.kjv: And Moses by the commandment of the LORD sent them from the wilderness of Paran: all those men were heads of the children of Israel.
verses.web: Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran according to the commandment of LORD. All of them were men who were heads of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: So Moses obeyed the LORD's command and sent them out from the wilderness of Paran. Every one of these men was a leader among the Israelites.

verses.kjv: And these were their names: of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur.
verses.web: These were their names: Of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur.
verses.ct: Here are their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori.
verses.ct: from the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
verses.ct: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph.
verses.ct: from the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Ephraim, Oshea the son of Nun.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun.
verses.ct: from the tribe of Ephraim, Oshea son of Nun;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu.
verses.ct: from the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Raphu;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi.
verses.ct: from the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Joseph, namely, of the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Joseph, of the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi.
verses.ct: from the tribe of Manasseh (part of the tribe of Joseph), Gaddi son of Susi;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli.
verses.ct: from the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael.
verses.ct: from the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi.
verses.ct: from the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi;

verses.kjv: Of the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi.
verses.web: Of the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi.
verses.ct: and from the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Machi.

verses.kjv: These are the names of the men which Moses sent to spy out the land. And Moses called Oshea the son of Nun Jehoshua.
verses.web: These are the names of the men who Moses sent to spy out the land. Moses called Hoshea the son of Nun Joshua.
verses.ct: These are the names of the men Moses sent to scout out the land. Moses gave Oshea son of Nun a new name: Jehoshua.

verses.kjv: And Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, and said unto them, Get you up this way southward, and go up into the mountain:
verses.web: Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, and said to them, “Go up this way by the South, and go up into the hill country.
verses.ct: When Moses sent them to explore Canaan, he told them, "Head south from here, then go up into the hill country.

verses.kjv: And see the land, what it is; and the people that dwelleth therein, whether they be strong or weak, few or many;
verses.web: See the land, what it is; and the people who dwell therein, whether they are strong or weak, whether they are few or many;
verses.ct: Take a good look at the land and the people living there. Find out whether they're strong or weak, and whether there are many of them or just a few.

verses.kjv: And what the land is that they dwell in, whether it be good or bad; and what cities they be that they dwell in, whether in tents, or in strong holds;
verses.web: and what the land is that they dwell in, whether it is good or bad; and what cities they are that they dwell in, whether in camps, or in strongholds;
verses.ct: Check whether the land they live in is good or bad, and whether their cities are open camps or fortified strongholds.

verses.kjv: And what the land is, whether it be fat or lean, whether there be wood therein, or not. And be ye of good courage, and bring of the fruit of the land. Now the time was the time of the firstripe grapes.
verses.web: and what the land is, whether it is fertile or poor, whether there is wood therein, or not. Be courageous, and bring some of the fruit of the land.” Now the time was the time of the first-ripe grapes.
verses.ct: See if the soil is fertile or poor, and whether there are trees or not. Be courageous, and bring back some of the land's fruit." It was the season when the first grapes were ripening.

verses.kjv: So they went up, and searched the land from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob, as men come to Hamath.
verses.web: So they went up, and spied out the land from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, to the entrance of Hamath.
verses.ct: So the men set out and explored the land all the way from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, near the entrance to Hamath.

verses.kjv: And they ascended by the south, and came unto Hebron; where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the children of Anak, were. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
verses.web: They went up by the South, and came to Hebron; and Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the children of Anak, were there. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
verses.ct: They traveled through the southern region and reached Hebron, where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai — descendants of Anak — were living. (Hebron had been built 7 years before Zoan in Egypt.)

verses.kjv: And they came unto the brook of Eshcol, and cut down from thence a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they bare it between two upon a staff; and they brought of the pomegranates, and of the figs.
verses.web: They came to the valley of Eshcol, and cut down from there a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they bore it on a staff between two. They also brought some of the pomegranates and figs.
verses.ct: When they reached the valley of Eshcol, they cut down a branch holding a single cluster of grapes so large that two men had to carry it on a pole between them. They also gathered some pomegranates and figs.

verses.kjv: The place was called the brook Eshcol, because of the cluster of grapes which the children of Israel cut down from thence.
verses.web: That place was called the valley of Eshcol, because of the cluster which the children of Israel cut down from there.
verses.ct: That place became known as the valley of Eshcol because of the grape cluster the Israelites cut down there.

verses.kjv: And they returned from searching of the land after forty days.
verses.web: They returned from spying out the land at the end of forty days.
verses.ct: After 40 days, the men returned from exploring the land.

verses.kjv: And they went and came to Moses, and to Aaron, and to all the congregation of the children of Israel, unto the wilderness of Paran, to Kadesh; and brought back word unto them, and unto all the congregation, and shewed them the fruit of the land.
verses.web: They went and came to Moses, to Aaron, and to all the congregation of the children of Israel, to the wilderness of Paran, to Kadesh; and brought back word to them and to all the congregation. They showed them the fruit of the land.
verses.ct: They went back to Moses, Aaron, and the whole Israelite community at Kadesh in the wilderness of Paran. There they gave their report to everyone and showed them the fruit they had brought from the land.

verses.kjv: And they told him, and said, We came unto the land whither thou sentest us, and surely it floweth with milk and honey; and this is the fruit of it.
verses.web: They told him, and said, “We came to the land where you sent us. Surely it flows with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.
verses.ct: They told Moses, "We went into the land where you sent us, and it truly does flow with milk and honey — just look at this fruit!

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the people be strong that dwell in the land, and the cities are walled, and very great: and moreover we saw the children of Anak there.
verses.web: However, the people who dwell in the land are strong, and the cities are fortified and very large. Moreover, we saw the children of Anak there.
verses.ct: But the people living there are powerful, and their cities are heavily fortified and enormous. On top of that, we saw descendants of Anak there.

verses.kjv: The Amalekites dwell in the land of the south: and the Hittites, and the Jebusites, and the Amorites, dwell in the mountains: and the Canaanites dwell by the sea, and by the coast of Jordan.
verses.web: Amalek dwells in the land of the South. The Hittite, the Jebusite, and the Amorite dwell in the hill country. The Canaanite dwells by the sea, and along the side of the Jordan.”
verses.ct: The Amalekites control the southern region. The Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites live in the hill country. The Canaanites are settled along the coast and beside the Jordan River."

verses.kjv: And Caleb stilled the people before Moses, and said, Let us go up at once, and possess it; for we are well able to overcome it.
verses.web: Caleb stilled the people before Moses, and said, “Let’s go up at once, and possess it; for we are well able to overcome it!”
verses.ct: Caleb quieted the crowd in front of Moses and said, "We should go up right now and take the land! We can absolutely do this!"

verses.kjv: But the men that went up with him said, We be not able to go up against the people; for they are stronger than we.
verses.web: But the men who went up with him said, “We aren’t able to go up against the people; for they are stronger than we.”
verses.ct: But the other men who had gone with him disagreed. "We can't attack those people," they said. "They're far stronger than we are."

verses.kjv: And they brought up an evil report of the land which they had searched unto the children of Israel, saying, The land, through which we have gone to search it, is a land that eateth up the inhabitants thereof; and all the people that we saw in it are men of a great stature.
verses.web: They brought up an evil report of the land which they had spied out to the children of Israel, saying, “The land, through which we have gone to spy it out, is a land that eats up its inhabitants; and all the people who we saw in it are men of great stature.
verses.ct: They spread a discouraging report among the Israelites about the land they had explored. "The land we scouted devours anyone who tries to settle there," they said. "Every person we saw was huge.

verses.kjv: And there we saw the giants, the sons of Anak, which come of the giants: and we were in our own sight as grasshoppers, and so we were in their sight.
verses.web: There we saw the Nephilim, the sons of Anak, who come from the Nephilim. We were in our own sight as grasshoppers, and so we were in their sight.”
verses.ct: We even saw the Nephilim there — the descendants of Anak come from the Nephilim. Standing next to them, we felt like grasshoppers, and that's exactly how they saw us too."
